title: John Legend, Chrissy Teigen back Elizabeth Warren; senator expresses gratitude for support
text:
CLOSE Chrissy Teigen told Ellen DeGeneres her "heart stopped" when she saw President Trump's tweets attacking her and her husband John Legend. USA TODAY

Celeb couple John Legend and Chrissy Teigen have broken their silence on who they want to see in the White House come 2020.

In a Vanity Fair cover story published online Monday, the famous duo came out in support of Sen. Elizabeth Warren.

“My favorite — I’m going to say it, we’ll break news today — is Elizabeth Warren," Legend said. "She’s the best candidate running today and she comes at it with joy and with sincerity and with a wealth of knowledge and experience.”

“I love Elizabeth Warren,” Teigen added. “I also love Kamala Harris.”

Legend also told the magazine that, as he sees it, many men struggle to back Warren because of her gender.

“Honestly, I don’t comprehend why guys hate women so much sometimes,” he said. “You see someone as transparently competent and eloquent and on fire as Elizabeth Warren and then you hear some guys just are not into voting for a woman. Why do guys feel so threatened by the idea of a woman president?”

“Our menses,” Teigen continued, whispering into his ear. “Because there’s 10 days a month where we’re just going to war.”

Warren expressed her gratitude to the couple for their endorsement in a tweet later Monday.

I'm grateful down to my toes for your support, @johnlegend! Looking forward to the day @chrissyteigen doesn't have to fight with the president of the United States on Twitter. https://t.co/bLdlaUcW4z — Elizabeth Warren (@ewarren) October 29, 2019

"I'm grateful down to my toes for your support, @johnlegend!" the candidate wrote. "Looking forward to the day @chrissyteigen doesn't have to fight with the president of the United States on Twitter."

Chrissy Teigen praises John Legend's sweet gesture: 'I haven’t been feeling like myself lately'

Legend and Teigen found themselves the target of President Donald Trump's twitter criticism in September after Legend was featured in Lester Holt's MSNBC "Justice for All" series, a report about the criminal justice system.

The report included an interview with Legend discussing his organization Free America, which aims to "amplify the voices of individuals impacted by the criminal justice system and those who are working to change it," according to the official website.

Trump complained when it aired that "people pushing so hard for Criminal Justice Reform... came to me as a group and asked for my help," but now he isn't getting any credit, seemingly referring to the First Step Act he signed into law in December, which allows prisoners to get more days removed from their sentences for good behavior.

Meghan McCain defends Chrissy Teigen after President Trump targets Teigen, John Legend

"Guys like boring musician @johnlegend, and his filthy mouthed wife, are talking now about how great it is - but I didn’t see them around when we needed help getting it passed," Trump tweeted.

Chrissy Teigen's all-time best mom-shaming clapbacks and most hilarious cracks ever

Legend responded: "Imagine being president of a whole country and spending your Sunday night hate-watching MSNBC hoping somebody--ANYBODY--will praise you. Melania, please praise this man. He needs you.

"Your country needs you, Melania," he added, before retweeting a photo of the first lady smiling while leaning in to greet Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau at the G-7 summit that previously had the hashtag #MelaniaLovesTrudeau trending.

"Ah yes, Melania is otherwise occupied. My apologies, @realDonaldTrump," Legend wrote.

Contributing: Hannah Yasharoff, USA TODAY.
